elements.title: Swiss Cottage Library (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that disputes in the acclaimed re­fur­bishment of Swiss Cottage Library (pictured) in London prompted the library's operators to sue its developers?

elements.title: Olga Onuch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olga Onuch is believed to be the first professor of Ukrainian politics in the English-speaking world?

elements.title: a podcast to support their employees (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Fallon, Jimmy Kimmel, Seth Meyers and John Oliver started a podcast to support their employees during the 2023 Writers Guild of America strike?

elements.title: Brad Olsen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a child, New Zealand economist Brad Olsen would write notes about stock market trends while watching the evening news?

elements.title: Iribe Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the University of Maryland's Iribe Center was partly funded by a businessman who dropped out of the university?

elements.title: Tony Stark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stan Lee modeled Tony Stark after 20th-century business magnate Howard Hughes?

elements.title: his 2000 book (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in his 2000 book, Michael Cook argues that the West prefers to "rescue" people after wrongdoing has occurred, while Muslims prefer to "forbid wrong"?

elements.title: Ninja of Heisei (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Ninja of Heisei, who robbed places in Japan while wearing a ninja costume, was caught at the age of 74?
